Package com.illposed.osc

Class OSCMessage

java.lang.Object
com.illposed.osc.OSCMessage
All Implemented Interfaces:
OSCPacket
public class OSCMessage
extends java.lang.Object
An simple (non-bundle) OSC message. An OSC Message is made up of an Address Pattern (the receiver of the message) and Arguments (the content of the message).

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    OSCMessage()
    Creates an empty OSC Message.
    OSCMessage​(java.lang.String address)
    Creates an OSCMessage with an address already initialized.
    OSCMessage​(java.lang.String address, java.lang.Object[] arguments)
    Creates an OSCMessage with an address and arguments already initialized.
    OSCMessage​(java.lang.String address, java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object> arguments)
    Creates an OSCMessage with an address and arguments already initialized.

  • Constructor Details

    • OSCMessage

      public OSCMessage()
      Creates an empty OSC Message. In order to send this OSC message, you need to set the address and optionally some arguments.

    • OSCMessage

      public OSCMessage​(java.lang.String address)
      Creates an OSCMessage with an address already initialized.
      Parameters:
      address - the recipient of this OSC message

    • OSCMessage

      public OSCMessage​(java.lang.String address, java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object> arguments)
      Creates an OSCMessage with an address and arguments already initialized.
      Parameters:
      address - the recipient of this OSC message
      arguments - the data sent to the receiver

    • OSCMessage

      public OSCMessage​(java.lang.String address, java.lang.Object[] arguments)
      Creates an OSCMessage with an address and arguments already initialized.
      Parameters:
      address - the recipient of this OSC message
      arguments - the data sent to the receiver

    • isValidAddress

      public static boolean isValidAddress​(java.lang.String address)
      Checks whether a given string is a valid OSC Address Pattern.
      Parameters:
      address - to be checked for validity
      Returns:
      true if the supplied string constitutes a valid OSC address
